item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, October 22, 2024 at 1:25 PM UTC
item.description:
1. One Plus One Equals Two (2006) (17 points | discuss)
2. Math is still catching up to the genius of Ramanujan (562 points | 270 comments)
3. First images from Euclid are in (802 points | 232 comments)
4. MQTT turns 25 (138 points | 31 comments)

10. Just want simple TLS for your .internal network? (110 points | 49 comments)
11. Advice for first-time inventors from a patent engineer (40 points | 24 comments)
12. Learning to Learn (153 points | 67 comments)
13. An amateur historian has discovered a long-lost short story by Bram Stoker (285 points | 108 comments)

19. Malcolm Gladwell Holds His Ideas Loosely. He Thinks You Should, Too (10 points | 3 comments)
20. When machines could see you (10 points | discuss)
21. Scalene: A high-performance, high-precision CPU, GPU, memory profiler for Python (140 points | 14 comments)
22. Mind Wandering: More than a Bad Habit (2018) [pdf] (106 points | 53 comments)
23. New discovery reveals how diatoms capture CO2 so effectively (86 points | 22 comments)
24. Singapore OKs 4,300km subsea cable for importing electricity from Australia (57 points | 70 comments)
25. Overengineering a way to know if people are in my university's CS lab (165 points | 73 comments)
26. Probabalistic Spin Glass (2022) (9 points | discuss)
27. Thought experiments that fray the fabric of space-time (124 points | 122 comments)
28. A near impossible literacy test Louisiana used to suppress the black vote (174 points | 191 comments)
29. Apple's AirPods Pro hearing health features (217 points | 142 comments)
30. Vimium – The Hacker's Browser (61 points | 55 comments)
